articles.description:
Oregon will achieve 100% broadband-access coverage with 19 awardees, 317 projects and 212 district grant areas  Oregon is investing the $689 million federal Broadband Equity, Access, and Deployment (BEAD) award to expand affordable, high-speed, and reliable internet service to thousands of unserved and underserved residents. The application window closed on Wednesday, August 6, 2025, with…

(Ashland, Ore.) — Southern Oregon University continued its historic fundraising run in fiscal year 2025, raising $14.17 million. The philanthropic total for FY25 is the second-highest annual total ever raised for the university; in fiscal year 2023, the university raised more than $19 million, including $10 million from Lithia Motors and Green Cars. “We’re generating…

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: A student walkout at Roseburg High over transgender locker room access has gained national attention, with major outlets and social media accounts sharing the story. Supporters praised the protest while critics called it discriminatory, highlighting ongoing debates about privacy and gender identity.
articles.title: Roseburg High Walkout Draws National Attention

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: Roseburg High School briefly entered a “Secure” status after a BB gun was found near campus Friday afternoon. Police confirmed there was no credible threat, but students were kept inside as a precaution amid ongoing protests. The situation was resolved and classes dismissed as scheduled.
articles.title: BB Gun Discovery Triggers Brief Security Measure at Roseburg High School

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: DFPA officially ended the 2025 fire season on Oct. 10 at 9:01 a.m. after recent rain and cooler weather. Restrictions are lifted, but caution is urged when burning debris. Logging slash still requires a permit, and some private or public lands may maintain fire restrictions.
articles.title: Fire Season Officially Ends in Douglas County - 2025

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: Jeremy Brett Vroman, 48, faces multiple felony charges after allegedly committing two crimes in one day, including a daycare burglary and breaking a home’s window. He appeared via video from jail after refusing to attend his arraignment and has declined a court-appointed attorney.
articles.title: Roseburg Man Faces Multiple Charges After Two-Day Crime Spree and Jail Outburst

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: Students at Roseburg High walked out Wednesday during eighth period to protest transgender students using locker rooms matching their gender identity. Counter-protesters also attended, calling the demonstration transphobic. Oregon law allows students to use facilities by gender identity.
articles.title: Students Walk Out at Roseburg High Over Locker Room Access Debate

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: Firefighters responded to a house fire Tuesday morning on Buckhorn Road in Dixonville. Flames were coming from several windows, and one kitten was rescued. The blaze started from a heat lamp used to warm baby chickens, officials said. No injuries were reported.
articles.title: Heat Lamp Blamed for Dixonville House Fire; Kitten Rescued

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: A Florida man has been arrested for allegedly starting the blaze that became January’s deadly Palisades Fire in Los Angeles, which killed 12 and destroyed thousands of homes. Officials say 29-year-old Jonathan Rinderknecht first set a smaller fire that later reignited amid strong winds.
articles.title: [National News] Florida Man Arrested for Arson in Deadly Palisades Fire That Killed 12
